data.q: Which module system is traditionally used by Node.js?
data.e: Node.js traditionally uses the CommonJS module system with require() and module.exports.

data.q: Which keyword is used to export a value in CommonJS?
data.e: module.exports is used to export values from a CommonJS module.

data.q: Which syntax is used to import an ES module in Node.js?
data.e: ES modules use the import ... from syntax.

data.q: How can Node.js treat a project as ES moduleâ€“based?
data.e: Setting "type": "module" in package.json enables ES module syntax by default.

data.q: Which file is used to define a Node.js package?
data.e: package.json defines metadata, dependencies, and scripts for a Node.js package.

data.q: Which field specifies the entry point of a package?
data.e: The main field specifies the primary entry file of a Node.js package.

data.q: What is the purpose of node_modules directory?
data.e: node_modules contains all locally installed package dependencies.

data.q: Which command installs dependencies listed in package.json?
data.e: npm install installs all dependencies defined in package.json.

data.q: What does the package-lock.json file ensure?
data.e: package-lock.json locks dependency versions to ensure consistent installs.

data.q: Which tool is commonly used as an alternative to npm?
data.e: Yarn is a popular alternative JavaScript package manager.
